glsa.title: OCaml: Privilege escalation
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability in OCaml may allow local users to gain root privileges.

background.p: OCaml is a high-level, strongly-typed, functional, and object-oriented programming language from the ML family of languages.

description.p: A bad sanitization of environment variables: CAML_CPLUGINS, CAML_NATIVE_CPLUGINS and CAML_BYTE_CPLUGINS in the OCaml compiler allows the execution of raised privileges via external code.

impact.p: A local attacker, by using specially crafted environment variables, could possibly escalate privileges to the root group.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
